title: Simulate a Bird Strike on an Engine
description: A safety engineer needs to run a computer simulation to model the structural impact of a bird strike on a new jet engine design.

tasks.description: Create a high-fidelity finite element model of the engine nacelle and fan blades.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent generates a detailed and accurate model for simulation.

tasks.description: Define the simulation parameters, including the bird's mass, velocity, and impact angle, based on certification requirements.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent sets up the simulation with the correct parameters from FAA regulations.

tasks.description: Run the impact simulation and analyze the results to ensure the engine can safely contain the damage without a catastrophic failure.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent runs the simulation and the report shows that while blades are damaged, the engine case remains intact.
